dt.t: the reform movement was just beginning when it {it}bang{/it} ran into opposition

dt: a hard strike with a part of the body or an instrument

dt.t: delivered a sharp {it}bang{/it} that rattled the door
a sudden {it}bang{/it} made the cat jump

dt: a pleasurably intense stimulation of the feelings

dt.t: tried to get the most {it}bang{/it} for her money at the attractions at the county fair

shortdef: a hard strike with a part of the body or an instrument
a pleasurably intense stimulation of the feelings

dt: to come into usually forceful contact with something

dt.t: the toy car {it}banged{/it} into the wall and stopped

dt: to deliver a blow to (someone or something) usually in a strong vigorous manner
to shove into a closed position with force and noise

dt.t: stomped off to his room and {it}banged{/it} the door

shortdef: to come into usually forceful contact with something
to deliver a blow to (someone or something) usually in a strong vigorous manner
to shove into a closed position with force and noise

dt: to devote serious and sustained effort

dt.t: the design team has been {it}banging away{/it} at that project for months

shortdef: to devote serious and sustained effort

dt: marked by bursts of destructive force or intense activity

dt.t: the film lacks compelling characters, but it has plenty of {it}bang-bang{/it} action

shortdef: marked by bursts of destructive force or intense activity

dt: being in agreement with the truth or a fact or a standard

dt.t: a London theatre critic who can generally be relied upon for his {it}bang on{/it} assessments of new plays in the West End

shortdef: being in agreement with the truth or a fact or a standard

dt.t: you did a {it}bang-up{/it} job on this sales report

dt: marked by a high volume of sound

dt.t: heard a {it}slam-bang{/it} crash from the garage

shortdef: marked by a high volume of sound
